intro: Jaegeria uliginosa, commonly known as bog jaegeria, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, pale green flowers that bloom in dense clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs and marshes. Jaegeria uliginosa plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
